lead_paragraph: Wary of Muslim immigrants after attacks in Europe, South Korea lets 670 Syrians stay only on annual visas, limiting their ability to find jobs and barring them from benefits.

headline.print_headline: Syrians Seeking Asylum in South Korea Find Only a Cold Shoulder
headline.main: Syrians Seeking Asylum in South Korea Find Only a Cold Shoulder

snippet: Wary of Muslim immigrants after attacks in Europe, South Korea lets 670 Syrians stay only on annual visas, limiting their ability to find jobs and barring them from benefits....
abstract: Many Syrians who fled to South Korea in midst of their country's civil war have become stranded in country increasingly wary of Muslim immigrants as prolonged conflict prevents them from returning home; South Korea does not officially recognize Syrians as refugees and is permitting them to stay on so-called humanitarian visa, which lacks many rights afforded refugees.
